title: Rights During Police Arrest and Custody
description: Understanding your fundamental rights when arrested or detained by police, including the right to legal representation and protection from illegal detention.

rights.title: Right to Know Grounds of Arrest
rights.description: Police must inform you of the exact charges and grounds for your arrest at the time of detention.
rights.application: Must be informed immediately in a language you understand. Applies to all arrests except under preventive detention laws.
limitations: Information can be delayed in exceptional circumstances

rights.title: Right to Legal Counsel
rights.description: Right to consult and be defended by a lawyer of your choice from the time of arrest.
rights.application: Can meet lawyer in private, free legal aid if cannot afford, police cannot deny this right.
examples: Right to make phone call to lawyer/family
Lawyer can be present during interrogation
Free legal aid through Legal Services Authority

rights.title: Right to Medical Examination
rights.description: Right to be examined by a doctor upon arrest and before release to document any injuries.
rights.application: Mandatory medical examination within 24 hours of arrest, you can request additional examination.
examples: Evidence of custodial torture if any

actionSteps.title: Stay Calm and Exercise Your Rights
actionSteps.description: Remain calm, ask for grounds of arrest, and immediately exercise your right to legal counsel.
tips: Clearly state you want a lawyer
Ask for written copy of arrest memo
Remember or note down officer badge numbers

actionSteps.title: Contact Family/Lawyer Immediately
actionSteps.description: Use your right to inform family/friends and contact a lawyer as soon as possible.

actionSteps.title: Insist on Medical Examination
actionSteps.description: Request immediate medical examination and ensure any injuries or health conditions are documented.

actionSteps.title: Apply for Bail
actionSteps.description: Work with your lawyer to apply for bail at the earliest opportunity through court.

actionSteps.title: File Complaint for Rights Violation
actionSteps.description: If your rights were violated during arrest or custody, file formal complaint with appropriate authorities.

variations: Police arrested me without telling reason

timeSensitivity.deadline: Immediate - rights must be exercised at time of arrest
timeSensitivity.description: Custodial rights are time-critical and must be asserted immediately
